<Link id="l00061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="61"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">      /// The \\p MF&#95;HUGE&#95;HINT flag is used to indicate that the request for</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00062" /><CodeLine lineNumber="62"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">      /// a memory block should be satisfied with large pages if possible.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="63"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">      /// This is only a hint and small pages will be used as fallback.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="64"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">      ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="65"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">      /// The presence or absence of this flag in the returned memory block</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="66"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">      /// is (at least currently) &#42;not&#42; a reliable indicator that the memory</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="67"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">      /// block will use or will not use large pages. On some systems a request</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00068" /><CodeLine lineNumber="68"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">      /// without this flag can be backed by large pages without this flag being</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="69"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">      /// set, and on some other systems a request with this flag can fallback</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00070" /><CodeLine lineNumber="70"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">      /// to small pages without this flag being cleared.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00071" /><CodeLine lineNumber="71" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sys/memory/#a548f317b89dc0bba738b89e5ce791395a1f8e817d37e6406698e099531487e3db"><span class="doxyHighlight">      <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sys/memory/#a548f317b89dc0bba738b89e5ce791395a1f8e817d37e6406698e099531487e3db">MF&#95;HUGE&#95;HINT</a> = 1</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00072" /><CodeLine lineNumber="72"><span class="doxyHighlight">    &#125;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00073" /><CodeLine lineNumber="73"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00074" /><CodeLine lineNumber="74"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// This method allocates a block of memory that is suitable for loading</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00075" /><CodeLine lineNumber="75"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// dynamically generated code (e.g. JIT). An attempt to allocate</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00076" /><CodeLine lineNumber="76"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// \\p NumBytes bytes of virtual memory is made.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="77"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// \\p NearBlock may point to an existing allocation in which case</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="78"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// an attempt is made to allocate more memory near the existing block.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="79"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// The actual allocated address is not guaranteed to be near the requested</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="80"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// address.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="81"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// \\p Flags is used to set the initial protection flags for the block</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="82"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// of the memory.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="83"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// \\p EC &#91;out&#93; returns an object describing any error that occurs.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="84"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="85"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// This method may allocate more than the number of bytes requested.  The</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="86"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// actual number of bytes allocated is indicated in the returned</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="87"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// MemoryBlock.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00088" /><CodeLine lineNumber="88"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="89"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// The start of the allocated block must be aligned with the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00090" /><CodeLine lineNumber="90"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// system allocation granularity (64K on Windows, page size on Linux).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00091" /><CodeLine lineNumber="91"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// If the address following \\p NearBlock is not so aligned, it will be</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="92"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// rounded up to the next allocation granularity boundary.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="93"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="94"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// \\r a non-null MemoryBlock if the function was successful,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="95"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// otherwise a null MemoryBlock is with \\p EC describing the error.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="96"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="97"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// Allocate mapped memory.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="99"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                            </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sys/memoryblock">MemoryBlock</a> &#42;</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> NearBlock,</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="102"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="103"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// This method releases a block of memory that was allocated with the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="104"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// allocateMappedMemory method. It should not be used to release any</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="113"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="114"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// This method sets the protection flags for a block of memory to the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00115" /><CodeLine lineNumber="115"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// state specified by /p Flags.  The behavior is not specified if the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00116" /><CodeLine lineNumber="116"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// memory was not allocated using the allocateMappedMemory method.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="117"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// \\p Block describes the memory block to be protected.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00118" /><CodeLine lineNumber="118"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// \\p Flags specifies the new protection state to be assigned to the block.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00119" /><CodeLine lineNumber="119"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00120" /><CodeLine lineNumber="120"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// If \\p Flags is MF&#95;WRITE, the actual behavior varies</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="121"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// with the operating system (i.e. MF&#95;READ | MF&#95;WRITE on Windows) and the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00122" /><CodeLine lineNumber="122"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// target architecture (i.e. MF&#95;WRITE -&gt; MF&#95;READ | MF&#95;WRITE on i386).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00123" /><CodeLine lineNumber="123"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00124" /><CodeLine lineNumber="124"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// \\r error&#95;success if the function was successful, or an error&#95;code</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00125" /><CodeLine lineNumber="125"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// describing the failure if an error occurred.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00126" /><CodeLine lineNumber="126"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00127" /><CodeLine lineNumber="127"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// Set memory protection state.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00128" /><CodeLine lineNumber="128" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sys/memory/#ae27409ddee7e191f33392283ca826703"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> std::error&#95;code <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sys/memory/#ae27409ddee7e191f33392283ca826703">protectMappedMemory</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sys/memoryblock">MemoryBlock</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a0e00fad9c34de40b1e31f3aa6f8e024cae1e4c8c9ccd9fc39c391da4bcd093fb2">Block</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00129" /><CodeLine lineNumber="129"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                               </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> Flags);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00130" /><CodeLine lineNumber="130"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00131" /><CodeLine lineNumber="131"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// InvalidateInstructionCache - Before the JIT can run a block of code</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00132" /><CodeLine lineNumber="132"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// that has been emitted it must invalidate the instruction cache on some</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00133" /><CodeLine lineNumber="133"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// platforms.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00134" /><CodeLine lineNumber="134" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sys/memory/#a5cfd4d2a8227a3f9ca0667f42f05f20b"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sys/memory/#a5cfd4d2a8227a3f9ca0667f42f05f20b">InvalidateInstructionCache</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#42;Addr, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">size&#95;t</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> Len);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00135" /><CodeLine lineNumber="135"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00136" /><CodeLine lineNumber="136"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00137" /><CodeLine lineNumber="137"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Owning version of MemoryBlock.</span></CodeLine>
